channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21218] KafkaSerDe doesn't support topics created via Confluent Avro serializer
item.description:
According to Google groups the Confluent avro serialzier uses propertiary format for kafka value - <magic_byte 0x00><4 bytes of schema ID><regular avro bytes for object that conforms to schema>. 

This format does not cause any problem for Confluent kafka deserializer which respect the format however for hive kafka handler its bit a problem to correctly deserialize kafka value, because Hive uses custom deserializer from bytes to objects and ignores kafka consumer ser/deser classes provided via table property.

It would be nice to support Confluent format with magic byte.

Also it would be great to support Schema registry as well.
item.summary: KafkaSerDe doesn't support topics created via Confluent Avro serializer

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I've made a quick fix for this problem - https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/526

milan.baran can you please upload a patch here to kick in the System test ?

please take a look here https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute#HowToContribute-CreatingaPatch

This patch modify KafkaSerDe to support Confluent message format with 5 extra bytes at the beginning of each message. There are two properties enabling this support `avro.serde.type=confluent` or `avro.serde.skip.bytes=5`

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12958256/HIVE-21218.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12958256 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

milan.baran can you please generate the patch with --no-prefix option ?

 
git diff master --no-prefix > HIVE-21218.2.patch

also make sure that your master branch is up to date.

Sorry, I'm not very familiar with git patch tho.

So what I did. I updated master to latest then I made patch through command line. Then I uploaded patch trought attach file. Should I cancel patch first and then submit patch? Or its just fine this way?

Why .2 in HIVE-21218.2.patch? Why not HIVE-21218.1.patch? Or should first patch called HIVE-21218.1.patch?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12958362 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Hi milan.baran, I was looking for the same functionality and found this JIRA.  It looks like this capability simply removes the Confluent bits but doesn't retrieve the schema by ID from the Confluent schema registry and relies on the traditional Avro SerDe (URL, file, literal) ways of deserializing the Avro? That might lead to unintended results since to topic can contain serialized data from schemas that Hive doesn't know about. Should a Confluent Avro SerDe also be added?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12958362/HIVE-21218.2.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12996474 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
bslim: Looks like everything passed in the last test run.

Thanks mcginnda
https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf?p=hive.git;a=commit;h=48bc9e389c9b88a6e25bec3fd19ed29130f3f156

Thanks, bslim!

 

I'm not seeing any documentation on the Hive wiki for Kafka support. It looks like based on HIVE-20377 that it won't be officially released until Hive 4, but I assumed there would be some documentation written at this point. Is there any existing documentation I should add this information to? If not, are there any JIRAs to write such documentation around for Hive 4? Or should we have a task to take care of that? Being the creator of the feature, you'd obviously be the best person to do that work if not, but I'm happy to help if necessary.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: KafkaSerDe now supports Confluent Avro message format.
